update.description:
**Depends on pull requests:** [sdformat  #470](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/470), [sdformat  #471](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/471), [ign-physics #40](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/40)

This pull requests adds the necessary components for supporting joints. Revolute2 and Gear Box joints are currently not supported in ign-physics.

The pull request also includes a fix for a bug in the way poses were set on links relative to their parent model.

## Example:

`ign-gazebo -f test/worlds/demo_joint_types.sdf`

![ign-gazebo-joints2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1308458866-ign-gazebo-joints2.gif)
update.title: Add support for joints

content.raw: No worries, I think we can leave it as is
content.html: No worries, I think we can leave it as is

content.raw: Since I already broke down `sdf::Joint` into multiple components, it was easier to just add a thread pitch component. Let me know if I should consolidate some of these components.
content.html: Since I already broke down sdf::Joint into multiple components, it was easier to just add a thread pitch component. Let me know if I should consolidate some of these components.

content.raw: we could fall back to a fixed joint whenever a joint type is unrecognized
content.html: we could fall back to a fixed joint whenever a joint type is unrecognized

content.raw: I think it's fine to postpone rev2 joints for now. I'll defer to @scpeters on what would be the best implementation, maybe 2 rev joints connected in series could also make sense.
content.html: I think it's fine to postpone rev2 joints for now. I'll defer to @scpeters on what would be the best implementation, maybe 2 rev joints connected in series could also make sense.

content.raw:
I have a couple more changes to make for the screw joint. Should be done today. 

Revolute2 joints aren't supported in Dart so we'll have to come back to it later. However, currently universal joints are used in place of revolute2 in osrf/Gazebo when choosing the Dart engine. Should we consider doing that?
content.html:
I have a couple more changes to make for the screw joint. Should be done today.

Revolute2 joints aren't supported in Dart so we'll have to come back to it later. However, currently universal joints are used in place of revolute2 in osrf/Gazebo when choosing the Dart engine. Should we consider doing that?

content.raw: @azeey , just checking, is this PR good to be reviewed? Did you take a look at revolute 2 or is that also coming up in the future?
content.html: @azeey , just checking, is this PR good to be reviewed? Did you take a look at revolute 2 or is that also coming up in the future?

content.raw:
Oh I see. I think it's ok to leave screw joints for a future PR.

I was also wondering about the granularity of components in this PR. I don't think we need to change it, but if it would make things simpler to have a single large component holding all the joint info from SDF for now I think that's ok.
content.html:
Oh I see. I think it's ok to leave screw joints for a future PR.

I was also wondering about the granularity of components in this PR. I don't think we need to change it, but if it would make things simpler to have a single large component holding all the joint info from SDF for now I think that's ok.

content.raw: Well..., this turned out into a much bigger ordeal than I thought. It's probably turning into a couple of other pull requests. First, I wasn't creating a component for the `thread_pitch` so it wasn't getting passed along to the physics engine. But then I  looked at osrf/Gazebo and found out Dart and Gazebo have a different interpretation of `thread_pitch` so we need a change in ign-physics. Also, there is a bug in my sdf dom update for `thread_pitch`. :cry:
content.html: Well..., this turned out into a much bigger ordeal than I thought. It's probably turning into a couple of other pull requests. First, I wasn't creating a component for the thread_pitch so it wasn't getting passed along to the physics engine. But then I looked at osrf/Gazebo and found out Dart and Gazebo have a different interpretation of thread_pitch so we need a change in ign-physics. Also, there is a bug in my sdf dom update for thread_pitch.

content.raw: Hmm, I don't think that should be happening. I'm taking a look.
content.html: Hmm, I don't think that should be happening. I'm taking a look.

content.raw: I also noticed that the revolute2 and screw joints just fall off, I guess they're also not supported right?
content.html: I also noticed that the revolute2 and screw joints just fall off, I guess they're also not supported right?

content.raw: Good idea to catch the error above, how about catching it here too just in case there are some internal errors?
content.html: Good idea to catch the error above, how about catching it here too just in case there are some internal errors?

content.raw: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/41/
content.html: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/41/

content.raw: Conflicts are resolved. fbb80cc
content.html: Conflicts are resolved. fbb80cc

content.raw: Yes, but I would have to do that in `ign-physics`. There are a few error messages there that just use `std::cerr`. I'll create a pull request that changes them all to `ignerr` or `ignwarn`.
content.html: Yes, but I would have to do that in ign-physics. There are a few error messages there that just use std::cerr. I'll create a pull request that changes them all to ignerr or ignwarn.

content.raw: Just a reminder to resolve the conflicts on this PR.
content.html: Just a reminder to resolve the conflicts on this PR.

content.raw: Thanks. Would it be possible to use the `ignerr or ignwarn` for these types of messages? This would allow a user to turn off error message using the `--verbose` command line option.
content.html: Thanks. Would it be possible to use the ignerr or ignwarn for these types of messages? This would allow a user to turn off error message using the --verbose command line option.

content.raw: Yeah, the demo includes a gearbox joint which is currently not supported in `ign-physics`. I wanted to keep in the demo to make sure all joint types are loaded by `ign-gazebo`.
content.html: Yeah, the demo includes a gearbox joint which is currently not supported in ign-physics. I wanted to keep in the demo to make sure all joint types are loaded by ign-gazebo.

content.raw:
I see the following error when running the demo world. I've installed the latest sdformat from the gz11 branch and I'm using the `gazebo_joint` branch of ign-physics. Any suggestions?

    [dartsim::ConstructSdfJoint] Error: Asked to construct a joint of sdf::JointType [4], but that is not supported yet.
content.html:
I see the following error when running the demo world. I've installed the latest sdformat from the gz11 branch and I'm using the gazebo_joint branch of ign-physics. Any suggestions?

[dartsim::ConstructSdfJoint] Error: Asked to construct a joint of sdf::JointType [4], but that is not supported yet.
